text:
Hello everyone.
I have a question about  `resize_image_url()`. As far as I understand, it simply returns a link with the query parameters. I added `?width=100` to the image path, but for some reason the image size does not change (it even became more difficult)). Are there any pitfalls?
hey, just commenting because I'm also interested in this. Haven't used it yet but when I try I will let you know (especially if your issue isn't resolved before then)

It sometimes takes a bit of time until the resized versions are generated. Until then, the original image will be returned.
Also note: images that are larger than 4096 pixels in height or width will not be automatically resized.
<@UHDEVB0S1> Okay, thanks, I'll wait a couple of days, I'll write here if something changes or not)
It should not take that long though - it should be fairly quick. Can you share the link to that image?
Hello Dennis, are you talking about the `hs project upload` command that handles a project's build/deploy?

Thank you very much <@UHDEVB0S1>. As it turned out, you still need to additionally modify the path to the image, add `hs-fs/` . `<http://domain.com/hs-fs/hubfs/path-to-img.jpg|domain.com/hs-fs/hubfs/path-to-img.jpg>`. As I was explained, resize_image_url() handles such a case itself

<@UCY83QS6Q> <@UAYBXDG4U> Hi there :wave::skin-tone-2: Hope your 2025 has been going well so far. I'm curious if there has been any movement on the idea of global state, or shared state between modules on a page. Thanks!
